title: Mediterranean Pearl Barley Risotto

ingredients.content: 250 g pearl barley, medium, rinsed and drained
1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade, vegan (see tip)
50 g sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained, cut in strips (5 mm)

preparations.content: Place shallots in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add pearl barley and, without measuring cup, cook <b>3 min/100°C//speed 1<b>.
Add wine and, without measuring cup, deglaze <b>1 min/100°C//speed <b>.

Add water, vegetable stock, salt, pepper and thyme (if using) then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>20 min/100°C//speed <b>. Meanwhile, toast pine nuts in a dry frying pan until lightly golden then set aside.
Add courgettes to mixing bowl, stir in carefully with spatula then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>10 min/100°C//speed <b>.
Leave risotto to rest in mixing bowl for 3-5 minutes. Add tomatoes, almond butter and reserved toasted pine nuts, stir in carefully with spatula then serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Thermomix risottos are deliciously creamy and super easy to make. Traditionally made with rice, there are so many other grains that can be used. This one uses barley which is an excellent source of fibre giving a healthier twist to a classic dish.
Prepare the vegetable stock paste featured in The Basic Cookbook without Parmesan and with vegan wine for a vegan variation of this paste.
If the courgettes are very large, cut them in half lengthwise first before slicing.
